title: What are some examples of personal domains of truth? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am not sure what you mean by “personal domain of truth”. I guess you mean the domain where the truth are inherently personal. That is the subjective innate knowledge which comprises your consciousness, mainly in the “form” of qualia, that is subjective percepts. The usual examples are feeling pain, felling pleasure, feeling being convinced by an argument, remembering personal memories (the smile of your friends, …), and usually our subjective (true or false) memories, your dreams, etc. None are truly communicable. If a kid complains about a toothache or an headache , his mother might have some difficulties to evaluate if that is real, or if he is playing a comedy to avoid going at school (like he did before, say). Consciousness can be characterised by what is true, immediately (first-person) knowable, non prouvable/rationally justifiable, nor even definable without invoking a notion of truth/reality, yet indubitable by each entity concerned. But we have empathy, and we easily attribute consciousness to those who are enough similar to ourselves. All the content of consciousness you can be conscious of belongs to that personal domain of truth, as such, even if some of those refers to some outer reality and are wrong. If someone believes (sincerely albeit erroneously) that the Moon is made of cheese, the experience of that belief is true, and belongs to his/her personal domain of truth, despite being wrong (assuming the moon is not made of cheese!). We cannot be wrong on such truth. If the little kids did not have the toothache, he knows that perfectly well. His/her mother can’t be sure, but the kid, and “God”, knows the truth, in this case.

Here’s a list of personal domains of truth: Your body: in any given moment, it cannot be anything other than exactly what it is.Your moment: only you can inhabit each moment within which you exist.Your emotions: no one can have exactly the same emotions as you, and your emotions, though they are ever-changing, are undeniably and irrefutably present as you live.Your thoughts: whatever you’re thinking is a real event unique to you.Your sensory experiences: no one else can experience exactly what you see, hear, feel, touch, and smell, and whatever they are, your sensory opportunities present themselves to you in some form whenever you pay attention to them, unless you’ve suffered the loss or absence of one of them.Your memories: they may not be accurate, or even real, but you have them, and they’re uniquely and truthfully yours.Your relationships: you interact with other objects and beings, real and imagined, and each interaction occurs uniquely for you in a unique intersection of time and space.Your ancestors’ circumstances and choices: you’re here because of those who came before you and who lived and procreated in exactly the way that led to your creation through your mother and father.The universe: it takes the entire universe to create and sustain the conditions that allow your unique existence.Your death: it’ll be yours and yours alone, and it will happen.
